sentences.en: Elvis always generated such a summons.
sentences.cn: 埃尔维斯出现时常引起他发出这样的召唤.

sentences.en: He had been accused of a drug offence but police had been unable to serve a summons on him (= officially order him to appear in court ) .
sentences.cn: 他被指控贩卖毒品罪，但警方一直无法把传票送达给他。

sentences.en: He knew that sooner or later he would obey O'Brien's summons.
sentences.cn: 他知道他迟早要应奥勃良的召唤而去找他.

sentences.en: He received a summons for speeding.
sentences.cn: 他因超速行驶而被传讯.

sentences.en: Her name was like a summons to all my foolish blood.
sentences.cn: 她的名字宛如战斗的号角,会使我这个愚蠢的家伙热血沸腾.

sentences.en: I hurried in response to my friend's summons for help.
sentences.cn: 我应召急忙前去帮助我的朋友.

sentences.en: I received a summons to the Palace from Sir Robert Fellowes, the Queen's private secretary.
sentences.cn: 我被女王的私人秘书罗伯特·费洛斯爵士召往白金汉宫.

sentences.en: It must be really bad, for her to ignore a summons from her mistress!
sentences.cn: 她居然不听女主人的使唤，实在是太不像话了！

sentences.en: Judy Trenor's summons was very welcome to Lily.
sentences.cn: 裘蒂·雷诺的邀请使丽莉感到高兴.

sentences.en: On the stroke of seven, a gong summons guests into the dining-room.
sentences.cn: 7点整时一阵锣声将客人召集到餐厅。

sentences.en: Police said they had been unable to serve a summons on 25-year-old Lee Jones.
sentences.cn: 警方说他们无法传唤25岁的李·琼斯。

sentences.en: She had received a summons to appear in court.
sentences.cn: 她已经接到法院传唤其出庭的传票。

sentences.en: The judge must issue a summons .
The summons was served by a bailiff.
They served a summons on the young man.
sentences.cn: 他们向那个年轻人发出了传票.

sentences.en: to issue a summons against sb

trans.tran_en: an official order to appear in a court of law

trans.tran_cn: 传唤( summon 的第三人称单数)，召唤，传讯（出庭）
